intro: Thlaspi fendleri var. typicum, commonly known as the Sierra Wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow or orange flowers and basal leaves that are typically rounded or ovate. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or mountainous regions. Thlaspi fendleri var. typicum is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
